description: Benny Gantz, an Israeli opposition leader in the country’s three-man war cabinet, said Saturday that if Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu doesn’t offer a new plan to bring back hostages and end Hamas rule in Gaza by June 8, he’ll leave the government.
title: Gantz Says He’ll Quit Unless Netanyahu Shifts to a New Gaza Plan

description: Thousands of people can now safely drink their tap water again after days of being told to boil it first following a parasite outbreak, the region's water supplier has announced.
title: Devon Residents Told They Can Safely Drink Tap Water Again

description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Benny Gantz, a centrist member of Israel’s three-member War Cabinet, threatened on Saturday to resign from the government if it doesn't adopt a new plan in three weeks' time for the war in Gaza, a move that would leave Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu more reliant on his far-right allies.
title: Israel's Gantz Threatens to Leave War Cabinet Unless New Plan Adopted

description: China is prepared to take countermeasures against the European Union if it continues a series of anti-subsidy investigations into Chinese companies, according to a post on a state-media affiliated social media account.
title: China State Media Warns of Retaliation on EU Subsidy Probes

description: Zimbabwe will get over half of an expected $60 million insurance pay out meant for four African nations as it reels from the impact of El Niño-induced drought that’s already slashed corn output and led to a state of disaster being declared.
title: Zimbabwe to Get Over Half of $60 Million Payout for El Niño-Hit African Nations

description: Italy’s financial police seized dozens of Fiat Topolinos which they said carried the national flag on units actually assembled in Morocco, in the latest fight between Giorgia Meloni’s government and the carmaker.
title: Italy Seizes Fiat Topolinos for National Flags on Moroccan Cars

description: President Joe Biden is stepping up a push to reach Black voters with weekend trips to students in Atlanta and business leaders in Detroit, signaling his need to lock in a bloc that’s critical to his reelection chances in November.
title: Joe Biden’s Atlanta Trip Highlights Duel for Black Voters With Donald Trump

description: Indian authorities have so far seized 88.9 billion rupees ($1.1 billion) worth of illicit money, drugs and other goods in its crackdown on illegal vote inducements in India’s six-week election, the country’s Election Commission said Saturday.
title: Indian Authorities Seize $1.1 Billion in Cash, Drugs In Election

description: Poland outlined a 10-billion zloty ($2.55 billion) investment in strengthening its borders with Russia and Belarus to deter potential aggression.
title: Poland Will Spend $2.6 Billion to Secure Russia, Belarus Border

description: Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico’s condition remains serious but the most recent surgery helped to bring it closer to a “positive prognosis,” a minister said on Saturday.
title: Slovak PM Fico’s Condition Moving Closer to ‘Positive’ Outlook

description: Vietnam’s Communist Party nominated Minister of Public Security To Lam to be the country’s new president amid continuing graft probes leading to the biggest government shakeup in decades.
title: Vietnam Security Minister Nominated as Nation’s President

description: China said its minister for agriculture and rural affairs is under investigation by the anti-graft agency for “serious violations” of the law, the latest high-level government official to be probed for alleged wrongdoing.
title: China Says Agriculture Minister Tang Renjian Is Under Investigation

description: India’s Election Commission on Friday raised voter turnout figures for the latest phase of polling, even as the government body draws scrutiny from opposition figures and other groups.
title: India’s Election Body Raises Turnout Figures, Despite Criticism

description: Police removed protesters who were attempting to occupy buildings at the University of Pennsylvania and University of Chicago Friday night, as tensions over the Israel-Hamas War once again flared up across college campuses.
title: College Tensions Reignite With Arrests at Penn, Chicago Campuses

description: The Philippines will purchase five patrol vessels from Japan amid growing tensions in the South China Sea.
title: Philippines to Buy Five Patrol Boats From Japan Amid Sea Tension
